abstract: Scoutmaster Julio Balde of Troop 102 in Newark announces he will retire and disband troop after serving Boy Scouts of America for nearly 75 years, during which time he taught survival and other skills to nearly 1,000 boys; Balde cites declining physical health and advice of his doctors as reasons for his retirement.

headline.print_headline: After Nearly 75 Years, a Scout Leader and Mentor Hangs Up His Uniform
headline.main: After Nearly 75 Years, and Countless Knots, a Boy Scout Leader Is Retiring

snippet: Julio Balde joined the scouts when he was 15. Now, a week after his 95th birthday, he will step down as leader of Troop 102 of Newark.
lead_paragraph: Julio Balde joined the scouts when he was 15. Now, a week after his 95th birthday, he will step down as leader of Troop 102 of Newark.
